title: Is Macron's attack on video games targeting the wrong enemy?
subhead: President Emmanuel Macron, who believes that violent video games 'condition' young people, has started a commission to 'scientifically measure their effect' on children. Yet hundreds of studies on the topic have established no link between violence and playing video games.

title: Pressure mounts on UK's Starmer as Scottish Labour leader urges him to quit amid Epstein row
Jean-Luc Mélenchon fumes after party is labeled 'far-left' by government
French central bank governor to step down in June, 18 months before term's end
subhead: In a letter to bank employees, Villeroy de Galhau said his decision was made 'with complete personal independence.' No reason was given for his departure.

title: Japan's Sanae Takaichi emboldened by landslide victory in snap elections
subhead: The ultra-nationalist's Liberal Democratic Party secured an overwhelming majority in Sunday's elections. The new balance of power is expected to allow the prime minister, backed during her campaign by US President Donald Trump, to accelerate the implementation of her hard-line agenda.

title: Mayor and mother: The young women changing France's local councils
subhead: Only 41 women under the age of 30 were elected as mayors in 2020, out of France's 34,885 mayors. Here are the stories of several women who have balanced their careers, motherhood and first terms in office in a political scene often dominated by older men.

title: How Donald Trump is rewriting US history
subhead: As the country marks its 250th anniversary this year, the American president, who returned to the White House on January 20, 2025, has worked to shape a revised historical narrative, revealing signs of megalomania.

title: Jimmy Lai, Hong Kong's pro-democracy media mogul, sentenced to 20 years in prison

Thailand's conservative prime minister defies expectations to win general election
'The ancient city-states Thucydides describes resemble the middle powers of the 21st century'
2026 Super Bowl: Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
subhead: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

title: Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
subhead: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

title: After the Epstein revelations, Jack Lang leaves a mixed record at the Arab World Institute
subhead: The former culture minister, who resigned on Sunday as head of the Arab World Institute in Paris after four terms, succeeded in attracting patrons and organizing ambitious exhibitions, but saw his projects slowed by a lack of commitment from Arab countries.

title: 'Dependence on the US is deeply rooted in the European mindset'
'Not only is Trump not crazy, but he is dangerous': Historian Laure Murat salutes Minneapolis 'lesson in democracy'
'The Kurds had Western support, especially from the US. That support has now been withdrawn'
